channel.title: archaeology on Hung Nguyen
channel.description: Recent content in archaeology on Hung Nguyen

item.title: Ultra-High Resolution Paleostreamflow for Southeast Asia: Proxy/Model Comparison
item.description: This project aims to develop high-resolution data sets of proxy-derived and model-derived paleostreamflow for Southeast Asia. We have submitted a proposal to the NSF P4CLIMATE program and results are pending. More soon.

item.title: RADIATR: **R**econstructing **A**griculture **D**ynamics by **I**ntegrating **A**rchaeology and **T**ree **R**ings
item.description: In this project, we aim to use stable isotope ratios (δ18O, δ13C, and δ15N) to reconstruct past climate and agriculture dynamics in Asia. We have submitted a proposal to the NSF DISES Program and results are pending. We have also received USD 10,000 in seed funding from the Lamont-Doherty Climate Center. More soon.

item.title: Hydroclimatic Variability on the Qinghai-Tibetan Plateau and Demographic Patterns
item.description: We propose new reconstructions of past temperatures and precipitations on the Tibetan Plateau. Combining our new reconstructions with existing records, we seek to explore the role of climate in driving past changes in demographic patterns. We have submitted a proposal to the NSF HEGS Program and results are pending. We have also received USD 2,500 from the Department of East Asian Languages and Culture, Columbia University, to develop the course A Climate History of the Tibetan Plateau.
